src:
Strahinja Gavrilović prešao u Breogan
Bivši košarkaš Partizana potpisao za španskog drugoligaša

04 Nov 2019

Zanimljiv košarkaški transfer nam danas dolazi iz Španije. Nekadašnji košarkaš beogradskog Partizana, kao i čačanskog Borca, Strahinja Gavrilović, potpisao je privremeni ugovor sa prošlogodišnjim prvoligašem, ekipom Breogana, koja ove sezone ističe visoke ambicije za povratak u ACB ligu.
Rođeni Kragujevčanin, koji je je četiri godine proveo u SAD-u, na Univerzitetu „Južna Karolina“, biće veliko pojačanje za španski klub na poziciji krilnog centra. Gavrilović je visok 206 centimetara, a u dosadašnjem toku karijere je pored Partizana i Borca, igrao i za Dinamik gde je započeo svoju profesionalnu karijeru.
Igrajući za crno-bele, u sezoni 2017/18. uspeo je da se domogne i Kupa Radivoja Koraća, da bi potom nastupajući za Borac u Košarkaškoj ligi Srbije u proseku beležio 10,5 poena po utakmici uz 4,7 uhvaćenih lopti. Na Jadranu je bio još uspešniji, pošto je dolazio do 12 poena u proseku uz 3,3 skoka.
Gavrilović je prošao sve mlađe reprezentativne kategorije Srbije, a ističe se veoma dobrom igrom u reketu, naročito u defanzivi.

Foto: 
MN Press
text:
Terror Gavrilovic moved to Breogan
Former Partizan basketball signing for Spanish second-teamer

04 Nov 2019

An interesting basketball transfer comes to us from Spain today. Former Belgrade Partizan basketball player as well as Čačak fighter Strahinja Gavrilović has signed a temporary contract with last year's first team player, the Breogan team, which this season highlights high ambitions for returning to the ACB league.
The native Kragujevac resident, who spent four years in the US at the University of South Carolina, will be a big boost for the Spanish club in the wing center position. Gavrilovic is 206 centimeters tall, and in the course of his career so far, in addition to Partizan and Borac, he also played for Dynamik, where he began his professional career.
Playing for the Black and White in the 2017/18 season. He also managed to reach Radivoj Korac's Cup, and then averaged 10.5 points per game for Borac in the Serbian Basketball League with 4.7 balls caught. He was even more successful in the Adriatic, coming in with 12 points on average with 3.3 rebounds.
Gavrilovic has passed all the younger representative categories of Serbia, and he stands out for a very good game in the racket, especially in the defense.

Photo:
MN Press
